newsitem.title: GREECE: ALPHA CREDIT BANK HOLDS PRIME RATE AT 17.25PCT.
newsitem.headline: ALPHA CREDIT BANK HOLDS PRIME RATE AT 17.25PCT.

text.p: Greece's Alpha Credit Bank will keep its prime rate for working capital and fixed asset loans unchanged at 17.25 percent, it said in a statement.
Alpha Credit, which reviews its rates weekly, said the maximum add-on would remain unchanged at 3.5 percent.

Its adjustable-rate mortgages are set at 17.50 percent. The bank launched 15-year mortgages in October 1995 with rates set at 12.0 percent for the first five years. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
